poem:
### In the Path of Flames

In the grip  
of a garden hose,  
the man stood firm,   
like roots refusing  
to surrender—  
while nearby,  
a woman sat,  
arms wrapped  
around her loyal fears,  
as the red waves  
crashed—taking  
not just bodies,  
but stories  
etched in ash.
